newsitem.title: UK: LPC-Sun Life seeks 300 mln stg loan-bankers.
newsitem.headline: LPC-Sun Life seeks 300 mln stg loan-bankers.

text.p: LONDON, November 13 (LPC) - Sun Life & Provincial Holdings Plc is seeking a 300 million stg syndicated bank loan, bankers said. JP Morgan is arranging the deal.

The five year credit is priced at 15 bps over LIBOR with a 7.5 bps commitment fee. The loan will be used for general corporate purposes and has a 60-day availability period. Four banks -- Banque Nationale de Paris, BZW, Royal Bank of Scotland and Union Bank of Switzerland -- have joined the deal as co- arrangers.
Sun Life and Provincial, floated in July, is minority owned by French insurance company UAP, which Tuesday announced that it is to merge with country rival Axa.

Axa and Sun Life said Wednesday that the UK Panel on Takeovers and Mergers has confirmed that Axa is not obliged to make a mandatory offer for UAP's minority interest in Sun Life. Axa also said that it has no present intention to make such an offer.

JP Morgan is offering banks that commit 20 million stg to the loan a four bps fee and the title of lead manager. Banks that come in for 10 million stg will get 3 bps upfront and be designated manager.
For further details go to LOANS
